title.narrative: Bangladesh: Enhancing Digital Government & Economy Project

description.narrative: To improve the efficiency and cybersecurity of digital government, and increase digitally enabled employment and raise revenues of IT industry firms supported by the Project.

condition.narrative: Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2: Project steering committee: The Recipient shall establish within three (3) months of the EffectiveDate, and thereafter maintain throughout the course of Project implementation, a Project steering committee (PSC) with a mandate,functions, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association. Without limitation on the foregoing, said committee shall:(a) be chaired by the secretary of the ICT Division and include representatives from the relevant ministries/agencies involved inProject implementation; and (b) meet at least once in every three (3) months; and (c) be responsible for, inter alia, reviewing therecommendation of the Project implementation committee referred to in paragraph 2 below for addressing problems that arise duringProject implementation and to take decision accordingly; giving guideline or formulating policies required for implementing Projectactivities; and carrying out any other matters related to Project implementation.

Section I.A.2 of Schedule 2: Project implementation committee: The Recipient shall establish within three (3) months of theEffective Date, and thereafter maintain throughout the course of Project implementation, a Project implementation committee (PIC)with a mandate, functions and resources satisfactory to the Association, and with staff in adequate numbers and withqualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association. Without limitation on the foregoing, said officeshall: (a) be headed by the executive director of BCC and include representatives from relevant ministries/agencies involved inProject implementation; and (b) meet at least once in every three (3) months; and (c) be responsible for, inter alia, givingnecessary assistance or suggestion for implementing Project activities; and giving necessary decision to solve problems arisingduring Project implementation.

Section I.A.3 of Schedule 2: Project implementation unit: The Recipient shall establish within one (1) month of the Effective Date,and thereafter maintain throughout the course of Project implementation, a Project Implementation Unit (PIU) with a mandate,functions and resources satisfactory to the Association, and with staff in adequate numbers and with qualifications, experience andterms of reference satisfactory to the Association. Without limitation on the foregoing, said office shall: (a) be headed by aProject director and a deputy Project director; and (b) be responsible for, inter alia: (i) planning, coordination, implementationand monitoring and evaluation of Project activities; (b) procurement and financial management; and (c) reporting on Projectprogress.

Section I.B of Schedule 2: Project Operations Manual: The Recipient shall prepare, approve and adopt a Project Operations Manual,in a manner satisfactory to the Association, setting forth the specific rules and procedures for implementing the Project,including, inter alia: (a) detailed description of Project activities; (b) results framework; (c) overall budget; (d)implementation arrangements for Parts 1, 3 and 4 of the Project; (e) modalities for providing training under Parts 1.3(i)(d), 3.2and 3.5(iii) of the Project, including eligibility and selection criteria and selection process for Public Universities andSelected Companies, monitoring and reporting arrangements and templates for MoUs; (f) modalities for providing Fees toBeneficiaries, including eligibility and selection criteria and selection process, and monitoring and reporting arrangements; (g)arrangements for funds flow, accounting, internal control, reporting and oversight; and (h) Project's safeguards requirements.

Section I.C of Schedule 2: Digital Government Operations Manual: The Recipient shall prepare, approve and adopt a DigitalGovernment Operations Manual, in a manner satisfactory to the Association, setting forth the implementation arrangements,guidelines and standards to be used for implementation of Part 2 of the Project, designed to ensure, inter alia, that theintegrated digital platform and BNDA are implemented on data protection and individual privacy, including principles ofproportionality and minimal data collection and disclosure, user control, network security and access management, and institutionaland governance arrangements, guided by international best practices and consistent with the Principles on Identification forSustainable Development, and and preventing vendor lock-in for new procurements,and ensure interoperability and common standardsfor digital government systems and infrastructure; and establishing institutional responsibilities, mandates and accountability forthe purposes of Part 2 of the Project.

Section I.E of Schedule 2: Provision of Support to Public Universities:1. The Recipient shall, through BCC, invite andcompetitively select IT companies (“Selected Companies”) for receiving training support under Part 3.2 of the Project, inaccordance with the selection criteria and procedures set forth in the Project Operations Manual.2. For purposes of carrying outthe activities under Parts 1.3(i)(d), 3.2 and 3.5(iii) of the Project, the Recipient shall, through BCC, invite Public Universitiesto submit proposals; and screen and select the proposals in accordance with the selection criteria and procedures set forth in theProject Operations Manual, including, inter alia:(a) that the proposals of selected Public Universities are approved by BCC in amanner satisfactory to the Association; and(b) that each selected Public University enters into a memorandum of understanding(MoU) with the BCC under terms satisfactory to the Association, as set forth in the Project Operations Manual, and pursuant to therespective template MoU prescribed in the Project Operations Manual, which terms include, inter alia: (i) the requirement thatthe selected Public University shall carry out activities financed under the Project with due diligence and efficiency and inaccordance with sound technical, financial, environmental and managerial standards, including the provisions of the ProjectOperations Manual, the Procurement Regulations, the Anti-Corruption Guidelines and the Safeguard Instruments; (ii) therequirement that the selected Public University shall: (i) establish and/or maintain policies and procedures that would allow theRecipient and/or the Association to carry out supervision and monitor the implementation of its activities under the Project; (ii)prepare and furnish to the Recipient and/or the Association, all such information that the Recipient and/or the Association shallreasonably request in relation to such activities; and (iii) accept random and/or unannounced physical or documentary inspectionsby the Recipient and/or the Association for the monitoring of, and in relation to, the carrying out of such activities; (iii) theright of the Recipient to suspend or terminate the right of the selected Public University to receive any support under theProject: (a) upon any failure of the selected Public University to perform it obligations under the MoU; or (b) upon theAssociation declaring the selected Public University ineligible under the Anti-Corruption Guidelines.3. The Recipient shallexercise its rights under the MoU in such manner as to protect the interests of the Recipient and the Association and to accomplishthe purposes of the Financing. Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipient shall not assign, amend, abrogate orwaive the MoU or any of its provisions.

Section I.F of Schedule 2: Fees to Public University Teachers:1. For the purpose of carrying out activities under Part 3.5(ii) ofthe Project, the Recipient shall, through BCC, competitively select teachers (“Beneficiaries”) from selected Public Universities toreceive Fees for research and innovation initiatives, in accordance with the eligibility and selection criteria and procedures andtransaction mechanisms and using appropriate documents, acceptable to the Association and set forth in the Project OperationsManual, such mechanisms to include, inter alia:(a) for payment of the Fees for the first time, confirmation that the Beneficiaryhas started the proposed research and innovation initiative, such confirmation to be made in accordance with the terms set forth inthe Project Operations Manual; and(b) for continued payment of Fees, confirmation that the Beneficiary has been makingsatisfactory progress in the proposed research and innovation initiative, such confirmation to be made in accordance with the termsset forth in the Project Operations Manual; and(c) the right of the Recipient to suspend or terminate the provision of Fees toany Beneficiary upon any failure of such Beneficiary to perform her/his obligations in accordance with the Project OperationsManual.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the Beneficiary shall: (a) establish and/or maintain policies and procedures thatwould allow the Recipient and/or the Association to carry out supervision and monitoring of the implementation of the Beneficiary'sactivities under the Project; (b) prepare and furnish to the Recipient and/or the Association, all such information that theRecipient and/or the Association may reasonably request in relation to the Beneficiary's activities under the Project; and(c) accept random and/or unannounced physical or documentary inspections by the Recipient and/or the Association for themonitoring of, and in relation to, the carrying out of the Beneficiary's activities under the Project.

Section I.G of Schedule 2: Data Protection and Privacy: The Recipient, through BCC, shall cause an independent report by legal andtechnical expert with recipient country knowledge and experience, under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association, to beprepared and delivered to the ICT Division for transmission to Minister of ICT, for review, endorsement and publication, withintwenty-four (24) months of the Effective Date. Such report shall include an analysis of the policy, legal and regulatory frameworkrelating to data protection, and data privacy and reform, having regard to principles of proportionality and minimal datacollection and disclosure, user control, network security and access management, and institutional and governance arrangements,guided by international good practices, including the Principles on Identification for Sustainable Development, and makerecommendations for policy, legal and/or regulatory reforms based on such analysis.

Section I.H of Schedule 2: Expenditures to be Exclusively Financed with Counterpart Funds: The Recipient shall: (a) ensure that thefollowing expenditures are financed exclusively out of its own resources and not out of the proceeds of the Financing; and (b)provide, promptly as needed, the resources needed for this purpose: (i) all costs associated with land and land use rightsrequired for the purposes of the Project; (ii) all resettlement and rehabilitation compensation and other assistance to AffectedPersons, in each case in accordance with the RPF and any plan(s) prepared or to be prepared thereunder; (iii) procurement ofvehicles, recurrent expenditures for the purpose of attending meetings, conferences, seminars, workshops and study visits (sittingallowances / cash per diems / honoraria, notwithstanding eligible expenditures under Incremental Operating Costs and Training), andrecurrent expenditures for fuel, under the Project; and(iv) taxes exceeding fifteen (15) percent of the total amount ofFinancing.
